com.atakmap.android.user

Class SpecialPointButtonTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.toolbar.Tool
      • com.atakmap.android.user.SpecialPointButtonTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.view.View.OnKeyListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SelectPointButtonTool, SpiButtonTool

    public abstract class SpecialPointButtonTool
extends Tool
    This class is the base for the buttons that have more than an on and off state. Examples of these buttons are the Red X (SelectPoint) and the SPI points. These buttons currently have three states off (marker not visible), enabled (where the tool is on), and disabled (where the tool is off, but the point still visible). This should eliminate most of the confusion and weird states previously associated with the Red X and SPI.

        @Deprecated
public boolean setActionMenuData(ActionMenuData amd)
        Deprecated. No longer used - see NavView
        Set the ActionMenuData object for this tool. Only one instance per tool. If the ActionMenuData item is already set, it will not be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        amd - ActionMenuData item to set.
        Returns:
        Result of setting. True indicates success and the ActionMenuData item has been set. False indicates that the item was already set and has not been saved.
